Tutorial_1:
To resume tutorial messages, click the book button on the right side of the screen.
Currently hidden.
Tutorial_2:
To turn off tutorial messages, click the book button on the right side of the screen.
Currently shown.
Tutorial1: Use the WASD keys, arrow keys, or left mouse button to move your character.
Tutorial1_1: Skip the message by pressing Enter, Space, or left mouse button when you see this symbol -
Tutorial2: Use the Enter, Space, or left mouse button to interact with objects that are near your character.
Tutorial3:
This is a game event.
At the bottom is a text description of what is happening. Often, this is a test of your character's skills.
Choose one of the available options to see the result - SUCCESS or FAIL.
Tutorial4:
STRENGTH is responsible for the use of physical impact and physical damage.
This indicator determines how much damage your character can inflict on an enemy using fists or melee weapons.
Tutorial5:
The check consists of a random number and a threat modifier.
A characteristic such as INTUITION can reduce the check indicator in favor of the hero.
Tutorial6:
In the future, you will be able to increase any of your character's characteristics, as well as use other unique options in game events.
Some PERKS also increase certain character characteristics.
Tutorial7:
Failures in checks carry a penalty. What happens in the game traumatizes your character's body and mind.
Even during a fight with an enemy, your character can lose part of his SANITY.
SANITY is an important characteristic, and if you lose it, the hero will go crazy.
Tutorial8:
Your character's current STRENGTH and SANITY stats are now displayed on the screen.
Take care of your character and beware of sudden checks.
Tutorial9:
Game events happen to the hero during exploration.
When your character is exploring a location, there is a high probability of encountering an enemy or a random game event occurring.
Tutorial10:
WISDOM stat determines your character's knowledge of the world and ability to apply this knowledge.
WISDOM also increases experience gained from events and encounters with enemies.
A WISE character reaches the next level faster.
Tutorial10_1:
Your character's current WISDOM stat is displayed as a number in square brackets.
Click on the selected action to find out the difficulty and see the check result.
Tutorial10_2:
Your character has SUCCESSFULLY passed the test. The difficulty of the game event was lower than your current WISDOM.
Successful completion of the event is rewarded with a bonus. Bonuses come in different types.
Tutorial10_3:
You have received an important item, as well as an experience bonus.
After any event, successful or unsuccessful, the hero receives some experience.
All experience gained is summed up and multiplied by the current WISDOM indicator.
Tutorial10_4:
Your character's current wisdom indicator is now visible on the screen.
Increase WISDOM and your character will be able to receive more experience and level up faster.
Tutorial11:
In some events, you can avoid checks by using a certain ITEM.
Using an item guarantees success in completing the event.
Select the available option to use the ITEM.
Tutorial12:
HEALTH decreases when the character receives serious injuries in battle or in-game events.
If HEALTH drops to zero, the character will die.
Tutorial12_1:
Use special items to RESTORE your character's health and sanity.
Items can be found anywhere.
Tutorial13:
You picked up a restorative item.
To use it, open the character menu by pressing SHIFT, ESC, INS, or RIGHT CLICK.
Tutorial13_1:
Open INVENTORY.
This menu contains all of the items you've found throughout the game.
Tutorial13_2:
In your inventory, you'll see different tabs such as ITEMS, WEAPONS, AMMO, and DOCUMENTS.
Click on the ITEMS tab.
Tutorial13_3:
This contains consumables and story-critical items.
Click on the item PAINKILLER to use it.
Tutorial13_4: To exit the menu, press the SHIFT, ESC, INS keys or RIGHT CLICK several times.
Tutorial14: Find a way to DISTRACT the dog.
Tutorial15: Select the available button on the panel. Each time you enter the elevator, you will only have ONE floor available for exploration.
Tutorial16: The ENDURANCE indicator reflects the hero's body's ability to withstand enemy attacks and any harmful effects.
Tutorial17:
Your character's current STAMINA is shown as a number in square brackets.
Click on the selected action to learn the difficulty and see the result of the check.
Tutorial18: By increasing STAMINA, your character becomes immune to serious physical injuries.
Tutorial19: The spot of light that surrounds the character is the VISIBILITY HALO. The HALO appears when your character enters a very dark place. The size of the halo depends on the character's PERCEPTION level.
Tutorial20:
PERCEPTION reflects the development of the character's senses and this stat is also checked in game events.
The sum of coordination and perception determines the damage from firearms.
Tutorial21:
This event tests your character's PERCEPTION.
The current PERCEPTION is shown as a number in square brackets. brackets.
Click on the selected action to find out the difficulty and see the result of the check.
Tutorial22:
You are in combat mode.
Your character and the enemy act in turns. Each enemy has its own tactics and set of skills.
Tutorial23:
The list on the left contains the available actions in battle.
The window on the right contains your character's data: the amount of physical HEALTH, the SANITY bar and the ADRENALINE scale.
Tutorial24:
ADRENALINE is needed to use skills in battle.
The character earns ADRENALINE throughout the battle, and for receiving damage - it is more.
Tutorial25:
To survive, sometimes you have to escape from the battlefield.
Press the ESC, INS or RIGHT MOUSE BUTTON buttons to get to the selection menu and RETREAT.
Tutorial26:
Click the ATTACK action to hit the enemy with an equipped weapon or fist.
Damage is based on your total STRENGTH, subtracted from STAMINA enemy.
Tutorial27:
The DEFENSE command allows you to reduce damage, but it costs a turn.
Use DEFENSE to accumulate ADRENALINE and use the skill in battle.
Tutorial28:
The SKILL command displays the PERKS and skills available to the character.
SKILLS can be used in battle if you have enough ADRENALINE, and PERKS act passively.
Tutorial29:
The ITEM section contains the character's inventory.
This list only displays those items that the character can use in battle.
Tutorial30:
The WEAPON command allows you to change the weapon equipped without losing your turn.
If necessary, in the AMMUNITION subsection, you can change the type of ammunition used.
Tutorial31:
FIREARMS use various AMMUNITION.
Go to the EQUIPMENT - AMMUNITION section to load your pistol.
Tutorial32:
The weapons and ammunition you find are located in the character menu.
Enter the menu by pressing ESC, INS or RIGHT MOUSE BUTTON and select the EQUIPMENT tab.
Tutorial33:
Click the EQUIP button and select WEAPON to see all available weapons.
In order to fire a firearm, you must equip ammunition.
Tutorial34:
To put away a weapon, click on WEAPON again and select an empty slot.
To exit the menu, press the ESC, INS or RIGHT MOUSE BUTTON buttons.
Tutorial35:
Some enemy actions cause your hero to lose SANITY.
Block such attacks are impossible. However, even having lost all your SANITY, your character is able to continue the fight.
Tutorial36: Use the bell in a special place.
Tutorial37:
You are in a SAFE ROOM.
Here your hero can rest and gain strength, being sure that no one will attack him in this place.
Tutorial38:
You have found an analogue of the local currency.
Collect money to purchase the necessary items from the vending machine.
Tutorial39:
You have picked up a DOCUMENT.
The documents and notes found can be read again in the character menu - ITEMS - DOCUMENTS.
Tutorial40:
Exploring locations, game events and running away from enemies consume COUNTDOWN.
COUNTDOWN is a special counter, the zeroing of which brings the main the hero in mortal danger.
Tutorial41:
Keep track of the remaining time to know how much time you have left.
Act as efficiently as possible, avoid accidental collisions, otherwise the Hotel Concierge will come for you.
Tutorial42: The COORDINATION indicator determines how well your character controls his own body.
Tutorial43:
Your character's current COORDINATION indicator is displayed as a number in square brackets.
Click on the selected action to find out the difficulty and see the result of the check.
Tutorial44: The sum of coordination and perception determines the damage from firearms. Coordination also affects the character's speed in battle and his ability to dodge enemy attacks.
Tutorial45:
Use an item to restore SANITY.
If the character's SANITY indicator drops to 0 during battle, you will still have the opportunity to restore it using a special item.
Tutorial46:
INTUITION, like a sixth sense, tells your character the right decision.
This is an especially useful stat for achieving success in game events.
Tutorial47:
Your character's current INTUITION indicator is displayed as a number in square brackets.
Click on the selected action to find out the difficulty and see the check result.
Tutorial48: Develop your character's INTUITION to decrease the countdown speed and increase the chances of avoid combat.
Tutorial49: PERKS provide your character with advantages that take effect as soon as you receive them.
Tutorial50:
Some events allow you to avoid checks by using a certain PERK.
Using a PERK guarantees SUCCESS in completing the event. Unlike an item, a PERK can be used multiple times.
Tutorial51:
Different events may have different PERKS that are useful. To see the option a PERK unlocks, you must have it equipped at the start of the event.
Select an available option to apply an existing PERK.
EnterCode001: The door is locked with a combination lock.
EnterCode_0:
Blood splatters across the wall, forming ominous symbols. Leaning closer, you try to decipher the encrypted writing, but the letters dance and slip away like ghosts in the night fog.
You can only recognize three numbers.
EnterCode_01: A piece of the wall here consits of human skin, on which four numbers are carved:
EnterCode_02: Blood is still oozing from deep wounds.
System1: General settings that alter the way the game behaves.
System4: Game remembers the last command selected during battle.
System6: Changes the speed text is displayed during messages.
System8: Adjust the audio settings for the game.
System10: Settings that adjust the visual properties of the game.
System12_3: value. Hold SHIFT while pressing LEFT/RIGHT to adjust more.
System13_3: value. Hold SHIFT while pressing LEFT/RIGHT to adjust more.
System14_3: value. Hold SHIFT while pressing LEFT/RIGHT to adjust more.
System16: Turns animated tiles ON or OFF.
System18: Changes the speed of battle animations.
System20: Turn this ON if your monitor runs above 60 FPS to synchronize the game to run at 60 FPS.
System22: Change the way you can control the game.
System23: Do you want to choose this hero?
TextPlug-34: Please, select a save slot. To exit the save menu, press ESC.
TextPlug-35: Loads the data from the saved game. To exit, press ESC.
TextPlug-36: Saves the current progress in your game. To exit, press ESC.
TextPlug-37: Deletes all data from this save file. To exit, press ESC.
TextPlug-38: This save is for a different game
TextPlug-40: Do you wish to load this save file?
TextPlug-41: Do you wish to overwrite this save file?
SystemText-0: Do you wish to delete this save file?
SystemText-8: The door does not look very strong, but I won’t break it in a broad daylight. Someone will definitely hear it.
SystemText-9: We can drop down the rope here.
SystemText-13: But we don’t have a rope.
SystemText-15: The door is locked! Lock level is \V[0002]
SystemText-16: The door is locked! Lock level is between \V[0054] and \V[0055]
SystemText-21: Damn, this lock is too difficult. I broke my lockpick!
SystemText-23: I'm also curious about what's inside, but it is not a good idea to break the door to this quiet house.
SystemText-25: The chest is locked! Lock level is \V[0002]
SystemText-26: The chest is locked! Lock level is between \V[0054] and \V[0055]
SystemText-34: Yes, but judging from the lots of glass shards there were bottles of potions inside.
SystemText-35: Damn, this lock is too difficult. I broke my lockpick!
